Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of removal deferral refusal
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the officer erred in refusing to defer removal on humanitarian and compassionate (H&C) grounds
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Administrative deferral of removal under H&C considerations
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Alleged risks and H&C claims lacked credibility due to lack of evidence and repetition of previously rejected claims
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Lack of supporting documentation for H&C application, family support in home country noted
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 112(1)(a) of IRPA – enforcement of removal orders
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds, risk upon return, family separation
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Absence of new or compelling evidence, adequacy of family support in home country
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to file timely or substantiated H&C application
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None – officer considered submissions but found them insufficient
Crimes.Application_Factor: Presence of Canadian-born child, establishment in Canada, alleged personal risk
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Was the refusal to defer removal reasonable?
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient evidence for H&C grounds, no new risks established
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Untimely and unsupported H&C application, lack of corroborating evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Officer reviewed all submissions; process deemed fair
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Claims inconsistent with prior applications and lacking proof
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Application for judicial review based on alleged unreasonableness
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canadian immigration law and administrative decision review
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and completeness of H&C application
Crimes.Omission_Type: False or incomplete disclosure on entry or status documents

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of removal deferral refusal
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the officer’s decision not to defer removal was reasonable
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Request for administrative deferral based on H&C and safety concerns
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claims lacked credibility due to absence of evidence and repetition of prior rejected claims
Crimes.Evidence_Type: No proof of filed H&C application, insufficient evidence of risk or integration
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA s. 112(1)(a) – enforcement of removal orders
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Humanitarian concerns including Canadian-born child and alleged risk in home country
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of timely or compelling evidence to justify deferral
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: IRPR s. 228 – criteria for administrative deferral
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to disclose previous refusals and provide evidence for H&C claim
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None – officer assessed submissions and found inadequate
Crimes.Application_Factor: Family ties in Canada, presence of Canadian-born child, perceived risk
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Was the refusal to defer removal reasonable?
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: No evidence of H&C application, previously dismissed risk claims
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of documentation supporting H&C claims or new risks
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Submissions were reviewed; decision process was transparent
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Failure to disclose material information (previous refusals)
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Assertions not supported by evidence, inconsistent with record
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Late or incomplete submission of H&C application

Crimes.Violation_Type: Unlawful presence in Canada beyond authorized period
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether removal should be deferred on H&C grounds despite overstaying
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants remained in Canada after visa expiration, sought H&C deferral
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Administrative deferral of removal based on H&C factors
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Federal Court dismissed judicial review; officer's decision upheld
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign nationals with expired temporary resident status
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate considerations, Canadian-born child, fear of risk
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Strength of H&C claims, evidence of establishment in Canada, availability of support abroad
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and sufficiency of H&C application
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claims not substantiated; risks similar to prior rejections
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Submitted H&C materials, family context, country condition reports
Crimes.Application_Basis: Request to defer removal due to personal and family circumstances
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Limited weight given due to lack of corroboration
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal based on H&C grounds
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Enforcement of removal as soon as reasonably practicable
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No proof of new or exceptional circumstances
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential family separation, but countered by available family support in home country
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants overstayed visas and failed to demonstrate sufficient H&C grounds for deferral
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: All submissions reviewed; deemed insufficient for relief
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA s. 183 – failure to leave at end of authorized stay
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of documentation proving integration or risk
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Failed to comply with conditions of temporary residence
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Not applicable – primary issue is duration of stay
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Minimal weight assigned to claims due to lack of verification
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No exceptional circumstances justifying delay in removal
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient proof of H&C factors or danger

Crimes.Crime_Name: Work Permit Refusal under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of refusal to defer removal
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the officer erred in refusing to defer removal pending H&C application
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Request for administrative deferral based on ongoing H&C claims
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claims lacked credibility due to lack of evidence and consistency with prior rejections
Crimes.Evidence_Type: No verified documentation supporting H&C application or new risks
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Alleged H&C grounds, risk upon return, family ties in Canada
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Absence of new or compelling evidence to justify deferral
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to submit timely and complete H&C application
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None – submissions were reviewed but found inadequate
Crimes.Application_Factor: Presence of Canadian-born child, integration claims, perceived risk
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Was the refusal to defer removal reasonable?
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: No evidence of valid H&C application or significant risk
Crimes.Document_Fraud: False or misleading statements in immigration applications
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to meet procedural requirements for H&C application
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose relevant facts or file required forms
